Thanks Gordon, and really appreciate your quick response.

On a followup query, I have a situation where I want to crawl a single 
(local)site in the intranet, and really want to relax the politeness 
policy on my sedded local-site.

We have tried it out by setting some of the politeness related 
configuration settings, but of no avail :( After some time, there is 
only one thread running.  Is it possible to have a greater throughput by 
instructing heritrix to ignore its default politeness policy and be more 
aggressive(rather rude), where we can have more than one thread crawling 
the same site.

thanks,
Prasen

Gordon Mohr (@Internet Archive) wrote on 9/14/2005, 11:23 AM:

 > Prasenjit wrote:
 > >  From what I understand, if I use SURTPrefix and just provide a single
 > > seed, it should crawl only those URIs which are residing on the seeded
 > > host.  What this also implies is that at any point of time there should
 > > be only 1 toe-thread running, because of the same-host politeness
 > policy.
 > >
 > > Are my assumptions/understanding correct ?
 >
 > Mostly. However, by default Heritrix also assumes that if you've
 > retrieved
 > a page, you want the inline resources necessary to render the page (aka
 > "embeds") as well -- images, frames, etc. -- even if they are on other
 > hosts.
 > The same thing goes for an HTTP redirect response -- it's presumed if you
 > requested the first URI, you want whatever it redirected to. So those can
 > result in parallel fetches off your exact host/prefix.
 >
